rComments: He's a nice guy who cares about his students. Easy participation marks will bring up your essay. His evaluations are not super hard but not super easy. However, his lectures are not great. He clearly loves and knows the content (perhaps to well). He is really hard to follow and he teaches classes like a masters lecture. Don't expect to learn much.

Haysom is a good professor overall. I can tell he really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He offers great feedback and is VERY lenient with extensions. however, I find that his lectures are extremely boring. I was never able to really grasp what he was saying because he is very monotone. Besides that, I recommend taking his class

if you're a fan of monotone profs go for Keith! the content of the class was so interesting but i literally wanted to cut my ears off from how boring it is. Theres a 10 page essay like every other week so get ready to write!!! I wouldn't take it again but not my worst experience
teacherRatingTags: ['Group projects', 'So many papers', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: I had POL2107 and 2108 with Prof. Haysom. He's really accommodating and lenient with deadlines, on multiple occasions we were given extensions. Great prof and really cares for his students. Last term in 2107 we asked for a 24hr window for the final due to differing timezones, and Prof. Haysom delivered.

This is my second time rating Professor Haysom. I'm giving him a higher rating this time because I felt that POL2108 was much more organized than POL2107 and as a whole, the course was just a lot better. Nice guy, gives lots of extensions and does care for his students.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: Haysom's lectures are dense, but it's all relevant/useful information for assignments. He was really lenient with moving deadlines to accommodate the needs of his students, and found unique ways to ensure participation and understanding of the texts. He was willing to drop a significant amount of readings after hearing concerns from students.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Professor Haysom is honestly way better than people give him credit for. He extended both of our papers and changed the final exam after student complaints. Obviously it is a political thought class so the material is heavy but that's not on Haysom, it's honestly just the material. Have him next semester and looking forward to it.

Not the most terrible prof, but this class definitely wasn't enjoyable. I thought I was passionate about political philosophy before I took this course. As a person, he's very nice, but the lectures were impossible to follow and I don't think I retained anything the whole semester. He might be better in person, though.

I have so many regrets... This course was the hardest thing I've ever done. I wasn't able to follow his lectures because he tends to ramble a lot and backtrack. I don't want to be too harsh because I know this was his first time preparing for this course (and it was sudden), but... he does give extremely good feedback and answers questions.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: This was NOT FUN. The lectures were almost impossible to get through as he would lose his train of thought often. This was his first time teaching the course so it's understandable. There was SO MUCH READING. I could not keep up. His assignments were fairly easy, 2 papers, prompt questions and a final. great for asking questions outside of class.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Very boring. Difficult to listen to. It doesnt help that it is online. I appreciated that he posted his lectures online, it took a few tries to be able to concentrate on what he was saying. Speaks the way you think a philosophy teacher would speak, in the worst way possible. Is pretty nice. Grades fairly.

Meh. Lots of lectures, discussion groups are important to attend and with COVID they are not hard to earn marks in. Pretty easy-going class and I have him next sem but I'm not dreading the class like some professors. Take his class and I think you'll enjoy it.

Professor Haysom deserves a prize. Admittedly I am writing this review on the high of him having just extended my classes paper due date. He is very accommodating with his students and listens to their concerns. Class can be boring but for an online semester almost all professor struggle to keep my attention when netflix is open on the next tab.
Great professor and a great class. Don't slack on group participation and attendance. This lowered my grade a lot.

Meh prof tbh. He rambles a lot and is kind of awkward. Attendance is mandatory for your grade, but you can easily leave after the break since its a 3hour course. Grading criteria is unclear. 2 analysis to write and a final take home so if you mess up on one, redemption is difficult.

not the most exciting lectures to attend, which sucks because they're mandatory, and because assignments and exams didn't rely on anything from class, but he seems like he knows a lot about what he's teaching about. don't worry about doing any readings except those that you need for your papers/exam.
Very knowledgeable and eager to make sure you grasp the concepts discussed in class, sometimes lectures go on a little long (3 hours Friday), overall very nice, great feedback, light workload

Prof Haysom does mandatory attendance. We had no in class midterms, it was all papers and the final was a take-home. He gives us the options to do group presentations or papers for the exams. Socially awkward guy, but very friendly and means no harm. The content was not that interesting but was bearable for a comparative pol class. Easy grader too.

Very fair marker and easily accessible via email. His lectures are incredibly dry but you learn a lot regardless. He takes attendance each class so make sure you show up. Haysom really wants his students to do well and is always willing to make accommodations.

He's really boring to listen to, but luckily none of your lecture notes are useful for assignments or midterm/final essays, so you can go to class for attendance marks and do whatever you want. He's a nice guy and means well, I'm not sure if he's cut out to be a lecturer though.
Great prof and an even better human being. He's very compassionate & genuinely wants his students to do well.. accessible and kind!

Prof. Haysom is one of the best professors that I've had at uOttawa. His brilliance shines through his lectures, he genuinely cares about his students and above all genuinely wants them to succeed. I'm looking forward to taking more courses with him in the future :) Thank you Prof. Haysom!

Amazing, accommodating and easy to contact. His hour and a half courses are excellent. His 3 hour long courses can get dry (though group presentations help shake things up a bit). He is engaging and a kind grader (tries to find as much positives in your comparative essays as possible to give you points). Sad I won't have more courses with him.

Nice guy and a fair-easy grader, but the lectures are boring. There are no tests or exams. Your whole grade is based on either 4 essays or 3 essays and a presentation (your choice). You still have to show up though because attendance is 10% of your grade, but you can literally get A+'s without doing the weekly readings or paying attention in class.
Super sweet and understanding prof! If you need any accommodations he's always more than willing to help. The lectures are pretty hefty, but they are online. Take home exam as well!!

Professor Haysom is extremely kind and caring. Always open and willing to help and/or accommodate students when he is able to. He truly wants you to succeed, is knowledgeable and is of great assistance when you have any questions. I recommend him without hesitation!

Prof. Haysom clearly cares about his students, sets clear expectations for the course and was very accommodating for students. His lectures do get a bit dry at times but the course content was really interesting and he did make an effort to spark discussion among the class. Would definitely recommend this professor!

He's really nice and a fair marker. He might not be the most interesting lecturer but nice professors are really hard to come by so I always try to get a class with him. Lots of essays and readings but everything is online and he's very clear about what he wants.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'So many papers', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: As a french student or someone with an attention disorder, it's sometimes hard to follow what he says because he uses filler words every 2-3 seconds (um, uh, ...) It really hindered my learning and ability to concentrate on his lecture rather than on the fillers. Also finishes a lot of classes 1-2 minutes late, run if your next class is far!

He is the most dull, boring, and monotone professor there is. Very difficult to concentrate and pay attention to him. He is nice, but it's a shame he taught a class with such interesting content. The readings are also very long albeit you only had to read for the 2 essays you chose to do + midterm.
Don't take if you have centre or right of centre political views, you'll dread the content!

I've had Professor Haysom multiple times so I try to get a class with him every year. He's a bit dry but straightforward and knowledgeable. Classes are always easy because he wants you to succeed. Also, I've had medical problems my entire university career and Professor Haysom has always been accommodating and understanding. He's very kind.

Professor Haysom is a kind and caring person but lacks substance when it comes to lectures and teaching material effectively. Anyone taking a 3 hour beware of how long and gruelling they are to sit through. Fair grader who is reasonable and not out to get students. Work hard, show up and a good grade is attainable. Beware of Essays

I love this prof! I am in my final year of university and made sure I had at least one class with him to finish my last semester! His lectures may be boring since he is not super enthusiastic when talking, however, the content is there and is always available if you have any questions! Highly recommend
Haysom is one of my favourite professors! He is dorky, but exceptionally knowledgable. There is a lot of reading involved in his classes. I can't recommend him enough.

Haysom is a really nice and intelligent guy. His papers and presentation are straightforward and simple. His only flaw is that he's a really dry and boring lecturer. If you go to class, and just do the work. You will do well.

It's a weird mix with Haysom: boring lecturer, goes off on tangents, weird assignments, and odd examples in the lectures.  On the other hand, it's a pretty easy course as long as you show up to the lecture and sign the participation sheet.  No need to do the readings unless there's a synopsis on it because there was no final exam.

Incredibly boring class, especially given the class content. Avoid at all costs! incredibly hard to follow and hard to understand what you're supposed to take away as important from each lecture. boring. boring. boring.   He is however easy to get a hold of & answers questions as much as he can. but omg boring.
For a political theorist, he teaches research methods very well. It's a boring class regardless of who's teaching it, but it's obvious that he prepares very well for lectures.

He's a good guy and is always happy to help if you have questions, but his lectures are dry as hell, the course content is very confusing  and he's an extremely hard marker for midterms.  He seems like he'd be an alright prof for another class, but not this one. Avoid.

clearly a very intelligent man, but reads rather than lectures, doesn't ask if we understand, doesn't drive any particular point home or reiterate importance, doesn't pause to give us a chance to think about the content at hand. the result: frantically writing down everything he says word-for-word, not being critically engaged whatsoever.
Really nice guy who is very knowledgeable, however, seems to have a bit of stage fright or something. Becomes a better lecturer as course continues.
Great guy

Keith is a great professor.  Lots of reading, but expected for a 4th year class.  Seems to be a very fair marker.  He's very clear in what he expects and there's take-home exam.  Stumbles on his words a bit but doesn't really matter.  He encourages very interesting class discussion which is always a bonus!  He knows his stuff as well.

Very knowledgeable prof who clearly enjoys what he does and cares about his students. Very available outside of class for issues and questions. Unfortunately, found him hard to understand and follow due to his lacking communication skills (ums, ahs). Really wanted to pay attention, but found it difficult. Super nice guy and fair marker.
Very interesting lectures, as he is well prepared for his lectures. Easy going prof, but courses have intense reading.

Very difficult class, with very dense readings. He is very nice and understanding though, realizing the subject matter can be challenging, and will do his best to help. Lectures can be a bit stumbling, but he obviously really knows his stuff. Was always available outside of class to help. Professor is recommended. Mileage may vary on the class.

Good class overall, the readings are dense but you're in charge of 7 readings: 3 for presentations, 4 for small papers and a tiny final. Dont leave the papers until the end. No textbook but online readings. He was able to answer any question in or out of class and really cared that his students did well. One of the best PoliSci profs @ UO handsdown

This guy honestly cares about his students- a very pedagogical approach to learning, none of this research-intensive production+assembly line education bull. He stumbles a bit with "uum" and "aah" but if you get over that, then he's one of the best you can get! Talk to him in person, he's really nice!

This poor guy. He is a really nice dude, but just stumbles over his words, saying "umm", "hmmm" and "ahh" alot, which gets REALLY annoying. He is also a pretty hard marker. But don't get me wrong, I thought he was a good teacher. His slides were also really good.

Really nice guy! His syllabus was a bit confusing but when I screwed it up and missed a paper, he was cool about it. He gives wholistic and interesting explanations to any and all questions and no doubt you will be able to learn alot. He is really bad with his 'ums' and 'uhs' though which makes it hard to stay awake sometimes.

Very hard to follow as he constantly stumbles on his words. Did not do a single reading. Attendance is mandatory but no exams, only papers + attendance. If you can avoid this prof, I would do so at any cost.

Overall good prof. Not the most charismatic guy by extremely knowledgeable and is able to answer questions well, not get sidetracked, and develops his lectures coherently. I enjoyed his classes overall.
Very interesting course material.
too much work, and he doesn't ask if we follow/understand was he's reading (because he doesn't teach, he reads)
One of the most boring classes I've ever been too. The teacher is intelligent but has problems conveying the subject matter effectively. Any of his classes do not come highly recommended...

Interesting material but not very good at communicating. We rarely used the coursepack and the take home exam was fairly simple. Group project was good and really allowed you to learn. Not the greatest prof but definately knowledgeable on course material.

HORRIBLY BORING.  3 assignments + attendance. If you can write critically you can get an A.  Never opened 2/4 textbooks, the others only used to cite for ass. I don't remember a thing I learned in this class and I got an A+  Ridiculously overuses "um, uh, um, uh" to the point that it interferes with being able to listen and understand him.
He is an excellent professor.  I would highly recommend him for courses that lean towards the theoretical.
Great prof. Nice guy.
SO BORING!

Nice guy... class was not the most interesting though. The exam and midterm were all based on the textbook and not the lectures... which made going to class pointless. Great guy though, very clear on what he expects.

Course was a lot of review from first two years of polisci. Haysom was very helpful and a generous marker, but lectures are difficult due to extremely unfluent speech which was distracting. Panel presentations, which constituted most of the lectures, extremely extremely boring. Prof lost all our assignment marks at the end of the semester...
Very helpful. Very clear and concise!
easygoing guy, fair. doesn't bog you down with big assignments but instead breaks everything down into smaller sections.
